30 30

Celebrating 30 Years of AIDS Vancouver

The 30 30 campaign was created in 2013 to celebrate AIDS Vancouver’s 30th anniversary. The campaign pieces together the dynamic history of HIV in Vancouver, told by and for those who where there.

1990

1991

Bringing Him Back to Us

In 1991

  • Serial killer Jeffrey Dahmer is arrested. LINK
  • The release of Nirvana's Nevermind signified the start of the Grunge era. LINK
  • Gulf War: Operation Desert Storm begins with air strikes against Iraq. LINK

Local

  • PWN incorporated. LINK
  • Vancouver Native Health Society formed. LINK
  • Helmcken House is opened. LINK

Statistics

  • 704 Reported New AIDS Cases in BC LINK
  • 10 million people around the world are HIV Positive. LINK
  • 7,987 calls placed to the AIDS Vancouver Helpline

Global

  • Magic Johnson publicly announces he is HIV positive. LINK
  • Queen lead singer Freddie Mercury dies from AIDS. LINK
  • The Red Ribbon becomes the international symbol for HIV –introduced at the Tony Awards by Broadway Cares in the US. LINK
  • The The Kaiser Family Foundation re-launches itself and begins partnering with HIV organizations globally. LINK

National

  • First AIDS Awareness Week (Canada). LINK
  • Red Road HIV/AIDS Network created. LINK
  • The Drug refered to as DDI becomes available in Canada. LINK
1992

AIDS Vancouver - Prevent. Act. Support.

AIDS Vancouver plays a special role in providing quality health care to people affected by HIV/AIDS living in the Lower Mainland. It is clearly more than just a community health care organization. It is an organization whose presence and continued strength is essential to the quality for life of this community and of each individual and family who draws on its services. Our Agency is a vital community asset which everyone affected by HIV/AIDS can share, and in which we all have a stake.

Visit us at aidsvancouver.org

2013 © AIDS Vancouver
